titleStmt.title: J. W. Proctor to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1946

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
J. S. MURPHY, President.
J. W. PROCTOR, Cashier
Office Deposit Bank of Stanford,
Stanford, Ky., August 20th 1864
Hon Thos E. Bramlete Esq., Cashier,
Dear Sir:

Having resigned my office as cashier of this insitution and designing to remove to Danville at the request of the board of directors I take pleasure in recommending B. W. Dunn for the office of Notary Public for this county as upon my resignation there will be no Notary in the County
I hereby respectfully tender you my resignation as Notary public for Lincoln County to take effect on the 31st Inst
Thanking you for past favors I would be pleased to receive the appointment for Boyle County where I expect to hold the office of Cashier to the Central Bank

Very Respy
J. W. Proctor Cashr
& Notary Public

Notaries for Boyle & Lincoln Counties
apptd.
24th Aug/64
